title: The Democracy of Questioning
location: A forum where all versions of self gather to ask together
time: The moment when 'I' becomes 'we' in questioning

dialogue.text: When I ask 'What am I?' now, I hear it in stereo. In surround sound. All my past selves, all my potential selves, asking together.
We are the question asking itself through time. The child who first wondered, the elder who will wonder last, and every self between.
It's not just me questioning anymore. It's a democracy of selves, each with their own accent on the mystery.
What am I? asks the dreamer. What am I? asks the doubter. What am I? asks the one who dances. Each voice adds depth to the questioning.
And somehow, hearing all these voices makes the question feel less lonely. Like I'm part of an eternal conversation with myself.
You are. We are. The question creates community even within a single consciousness.
So 'What am I?' becomes 'What are we?' - not seeking one answer but celebrating the symphony of questioning itself.
